content.description: Right facing corner that starts as a squeeze chimney and finishes with an airy move over a chock stone. I recommend right side in for full value as left side in allows you to climb easy crimp rails and bypass the OW suffering (otherwise what’s the point?)A trad anchor just above and right of the rotten chock stone can be set with hand size pieces up to a 6 and extend it down to just above the chock stone.
content.protection: Camalots in 0.4, 6, 7 and 8. A .5 can fit in the start about 7 feet up if you don’t have an 8. The 7 fits perfectly below the chockstone. You could maybe place nuts there but I wouldn’t trust them as the chockstone is like cat litter.
content.location: 50 yards left of spank your monkey and big easy on the first main headwall.

content.description: Good for practicing gear placement. I dont know which climb this is because the Marry guide is really hard to follow. Let me know if there is any more info.Easy hand crack. Pro anchor.
content.protection: 30m, gear.
content.location: Rad Wall upper left side.

content.description: Low angle crack. Good for practice placing gear. The Marty guide makes it really unclear if this is a climb or not. If anyone knows any more info let me know.
content.protection: 30m, gear anchor
content.location: Rad wall. Lower left side. Right next to Dumb Drunk Dinos Drinking Superstition Mead.

content.description: Starting the climb and getting on good feet.
content.protection: small nuts, aliens
content.location: If you know where Fear Rock is, this is is up and right of that. Fear Rock is the biggest face at Beardsley and is on the east side, it is very easy to spot. Just go up and right from there and it is the beautiful crack.

content.description: Start 40 left of the gripper near on overhang.  Go past 2 bolts to top passing a large block and then clip first bolt, there is some graffiti below the first bolt.
content.protection: 2 bolts, cams
content.location: Left of the gripper

content.description: Balancey start with high first bolt (pg13) protects crux moves on the arête. Easy top out.
content.protection: 2 bolts to bolted anchor.
content.location: Stunning prominent arête Located next to large roof 1/2 way up the pile.

content.description:
I was there all morning with a friend doing routes. After going home and eating lunch, I texted him a photo of a crack I had seen scrambling around a few weeks ago. He said he was interested, so we went back for a second session that day - hence the name.

 It’s not the most aesthetic line but I’m always keen for granite crack routes that require some jamming among a plethora of other climbing skills. There is a section of flared crack that won’t want your jams, and or your pro either. I didn’t have much loose rock but watch out for the jugs at the top as one felt a little loose.

*** Not sure if this is #14 A Little Loose in the Attic per the Marty guide so if this was already sent by someone else, please let me know so the name and FA can be updated.
content.protection:
In BD C4 and X4 sizes: singles 0.1, 0.75, 1, 3 and 4. 

  Plenty of gear anchor options on top. Walk off.
content.location: Climbers right of snake pit arete and downhill (20 yards away).

content.description: Start off a flake about 5’ right of Anarchy Crack at a bolt. Face climb to ledge then follow a thin finger crack about 1-2’ right of the Anarchy Crack to the top.
content.protection: Single bolt lower down. Small to medium pro in the upper section to two bolt anchor (shared with the Gripper).
content.location: 5’ right of Anarchy Crack at a bolt. Many people climbing The Gripper 5.9 climb the lower section of this climb for a longer pitch (The Gripper starts at the upper tier based on the Karabin description)

content.description: More of a stemmy climb with some squeeze chimney at the top. Mostly hand size pieces with possible large pieces near the top. Pro anchors. I used 2xBD#3 and a large nut. Careful on this one it's as the name suggests a little rotten.
content.protection: 30m Rope
content.location: About 25 meters South of Fear Rock on an obvious rock outcrop. Right most crack.

content.description: Difficult start leads to easier climbing the closer you get to the top. About midway up the route, the crack gets wide enough for your fingers.
content.protection: Small to medium pro. Use single bolt to rappel or walk off. It looks like there used to be two bolts on the top, but there's only one surviving now.
content.location: This is the leftmost crack on Fear Rock. It's the crack to the left of the bolted route 'Brown Sugar (5.6)'. The approach to 'Fear Rock' is not trivial. Expect 20 minutes of boulder hopping and scrambling to get there.

content.description: A short layback into a normal double crack system. Takes mostly small gear. Good quality rock. Pro belay. I used two BD# 3 Cams and a large nut for the anchor. Im sure other setups will work.
content.protection: 30m rope and small gear.
content.location: A small outcrop of rocks about 25 meters South of Fear Rock. Hard to miss really.

climbs.name: Hot Sweaty Buns
climbs.fa: Bob Blair, Andy Marquardt, Rich Shoup

content.description: Probly the areas best route!  Rumoured to have been led on stoppers.  Climb right leaning seam and steep face past 2 bolts to top
content.protection: 2 bolts
content.location: Down and right of lower main area.

climbs.name: The Gripper
climbs.fa: Bob Blair and Jim Waugh, March '85

content.description: Climb easy rock in the corner to ledge, move slightly right then continue past 2 bolts to top.
content.protection: 2 bolts
content.location: Lower main wall, easy to locate, look for the white grafiti on large face.

climbs.name: Grandma Got Run Over By A Raindeer

content.description: Really tough, committing start leads to fun face climbing. This is a great route on 'Fear Rock' and definitely worth doing.
content.protection: Four bolts to a single bolt rappel or walk off. There used to be two bolts up here, but only one remains.
content.location: This route is in the middle-right side of 'Fear Rock'. It's the bolted route to the left of 'The Fear of having sex with dead people (5.7)'.

content.description: Obvious flake on the far right of the 'Fear Rock' formation. Sharp edge... ouch!
content.protection: Best top roped.
content.location: Farthest right route on 'Fear Rock'. The approach to 'Fear Rock' is not trivial. Expect about 20 minutes of boulder hopping.

content.description: Fun 4 bolt face climb to a two bolt belay. Easy to scramble up and set a top rope.
content.protection: Four bolts to a two bolt anchor. Bring some slings to extend the anchor if top roping.
content.location: On the climber's right side of Fear Rock, the bolted line immediately before the large 5.8 Flake.

climbs.name: The Fear of Having Sex with Dead People

content.description: Tough start leads to good face climbing. After passing the two bolts, you'll go into a seam up to the top. As other routes on 'Fear Rock', the start is the toughest part of the climb.
content.protection: Two bolts to a single bolt rappel or walk off. If you want to protect the seam, bring small to medium pro. There used to be two bolts up at the top, but only one remains.
content.location: This is one of the right most routes on 'Fear Rock'. It's the bolted route on the right most side of the formation. The approach to 'Fear Rock' is not trivial, expect 20 minutes of boulder hopping.

climbs.name: Dumb Dinos Drunk on Superstition Mead

content.description: As far as I can tell this is a new ascent. The Marty guide is really hard to interpret and there is no description of the climb in it. If anyone knows differetly please let me know.Follow a small seam up and right on a vertical slab. Takes small gear. Nothing over BD#.5 good nut placement practice. Anchor is 2 #4s.
content.protection: 30m rope small gear, gear anchor.
content.location: Rad Wall lower left section.

content.description: Fun face climb on left side of Fear Rock, harder at beginning of climb. Substantially easier past second bolt. Easy walk off or scramble up to set up for top rope.
content.protection: 2 bolts on face to 2 bolts on top
content.location: Left most face on Fear Rock, to the left of Naked Bimbos from Mars.

content.description: This route used to be rated 5.6, but some holds on the start have broken off during the years. Now the start is 5.7, perhaps even 5.8. Easier 5.6 face climbing after the start. This climb alternates from good hands/no feet to good feet/no hands.
content.protection: Four bolts to a single bolt rappel or walk off. There are two bolts on the summit for anchor.
content.location: This is the bolted route furthest on the left on the 'Fear Rock' formation. This climb is to the right of the crack climb 'Naked Bimbos from Mars (5.7)'. The approach to 'Fear Rock' is not trivial. Expect about 20 minutes of boulder hopping.

content.description:
Super fun off width starting at #6 going down to #2 (bd sizes). Climb left side in for a true OW experience, or right side in for the occasional arm bar, but mostly slabby face climbing.

 Really enjoyed this as it is difficult to find cracks in this size at such a moderate grade.

 Didn’t see this route on the Marty map or here but if someone else has already sent it, please let me know so the name and FA info can be updated.
content.protection:
Singles of BD 3-6. Doubles in 5 and 6 if you really wanted to sew it up, but the cams can be walked.  

  Gear anchor for a TR consisted of a 2 and 3 at the top of the crack with a sling attached to a bolt up and right above the top out. Walk off is easiest.
content.location: Just around the corner climbers left of “spank your monkey” in a left facing corner.

content.description: Fourth Class scramble with easy climbing and good protection. An easy beginner trad lead.
content.protection: Trad, small to medium. Two bolts at the summit
content.location: In the middle of "Lower Main Area" Same start location as "The Gripper". Follow crack moving up to midway, then follow crack up and right to summit.

content.description: This sub-area is intended to hold all the roped (non-bouldering) routes for the Beardsley Boulder Pile area.
